intro: Habrothamnus hartwegii, commonly known as Hartweg's flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain wildlife.
